entry.title: Anywhere and Everywhere
entry.summary:
Author: Thewriting_hub

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 67,938Chapters: 17/35Kudos: 466

Summary: Jason was your everything. No matter how many years pass, you'll never recover from how he was taken from you. You still saw him, anywhere and everywhere. Sometimes it comforted you knowing you would never truly be without him but sometimes it was very inconvenient. Like tonight, Scarecrow was planning on a mass release of his newest fear toxin, not to mention he was working with someone new on the Gotham crime scene but they seemed so very familiar.

entry.title: Red Hood, Green Heart
entry.summary:
Author: Persadol

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 90,840Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 109

Summary: Jason Todd has died before-and he hasn't quite come back whole. Haunted by shadows of his past and the weight of justice in Gotham, he finds comfort only in silence and the static crackle of Alfred's voice in his comms.That is, until the night a portal rips open above him and a very unexpected visitor-blue-skinned, horned, and definitely not from this world-crashes straight into his life. Literally.You're a druid from the forests of the Forgotten Realms, on a peaceful path of healing and harmony… until a bandit ambush and a wild spell gone wrong land you flat on top of a masked stranger in a dark, alien city.Jason doesn't do magic. You don't do guns. But somehow, between Gotham rooftops and druidic spells, trauma and trust, gunfire and green growth-you might just change each other's worlds.

entry.title: we're all reaching out to find another hand
entry.summary:
Author: soter

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,424Chapters: 2/18Kudos: 27

Summary: “I know you’re a meta,” you blurt. Jason stares. “What.” “I saw your hand—I saw the cut and the blood, but then, it was healed, somehow, right, and like, I know I wasn’t supposed to see that and then I felt really bad about it and I wanted to let you know that I know but I didn’t want you to think I was going to, like, blackmail you—” “Blackmail me?” “Of course not,” you quickly say. “Never. No. That’s horrible. Can you imagine what would happen if it got out?” You wince. “Sorry, stupid question, you probably have.”or in which you discover that your neighbor, Jason Todd, is a metahuman, try to compensate, and things get a little... weird.

entry.title: Strawberry Waffles
entry.summary:
Author: lushescape

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,984Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 189

Summary: “Like a date?” You ask in a near whisper. Jason looks like he's been electrocuted but slowly he nods his head twice. “Yeah. A date. You and me, the school dance.” Oh. Your heart feels like it's beating so fast it's going to stop at any second. But you nod, your face warm, and there's no way you can stop yourself from smiling now. “Um, y- yeah.” You stammer before clearing your throat softly. “Yes.” You say, more confident in your answer. “Yes, I would.. love to go with you. On a date. To the dance.” Or Jason Todd becomes a girl dad after dying and coming back to life

entry.title: so only one hand may rest its palm upon my cheeks
entry.summary:
Author: rileywhooshhh

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,308Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 50

Summary: batfam soulmate aus! all are standalone   You're pretty good at reading people, and you don't sense hostility from this guy, but the anonymity of not being able to see his face is intimidating you. When he gets close to you, you cower, holding the book in front of your face defensively. "You thought a book was going to hurt me?" he speaks, the sound low and gruff, lower than natural standards, and you're sure there's a voice modulator in his helmet. With a wince, you peek at him from behind the book, nodding slowly. "I guess I didn't really.. think it through."   Or, your soulmate dies young. You don’t expect to see him again, but the universe had other plans.

entry.title: Christmas Surprises
entry.summary:
Author: Ava_Mae

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,453Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 67

Summary: Her niece?Fuck.He let his arm drop so that he wasn't pointing his gun at her anymore. "Wait-- are you Jules?" The woman gave him an odd look. "Yes, I am.""Shit." He holstered his gun and took a step back, trying to look as unthreatening as he could manage. ~"No, that's not--" She let out half a laugh, sounding a little disbelieving. "I meant…" She shook her head. "Jules has given me gifts," she said quietly. "Christmas, birthdays, whatever. But I've… I've never had anybody else give me something that… I dunno, has this much meaning behind it." Ouch. She deserved nice things, and Jason kinda hated the fact that she was so completely unprepared for it. She touched the charm again, then glanced up at him again. "...you sure you're not gonna regret giving this to me?" she asked, a tiny bit hesitant.Never in a million years. "Yeah, pretty sure," he replied.
